issue.title: Trusty: remote_endpoint: Transport endpoint is not connected

content.raw:
We experienced the same issue when launching `gazebo` with a system plugin compiled in `Debug` mode (Gazebo version 3.0 from debian packages, Ubuntu 14.04).
The issue did not arise when using the same system plugin compiled in `Release` mode. 

If someone has the same problem he may be interested in a workaround. We launched `gzserver` (with the system plugin compiled in `Debug`) and after we launched `gzclient` in a separate terminal. In this way we were able to have a working simulation, I guess avoiding the `gzserver`-`gzclient` race condition.
